main event: A visual sighting of a large object more than 40 times the moon's apparent diameter, which appeared stationary before disappearing below the horizon.
interesting points: The sighting occurred in Boulder, Colorado, on a rainy and overcast day.,The object was observed for approximately 40 minutes.,It was reported to be brighter than any stars.,Witnesses indicated that the object moved to the west after being stationary., The sighting was associated with ground visual observations and noted to correspond with the direction provided by the witnesses.
witness description: Associate with Boulder Public Schools, seems reliable.
